title: I'm done playing support.
body:
I'm completely at the end of my rope for this role. It used to be my favorite role, but i am tired of losing games because of a role that can't really carry. Like i can do everything in my power to set up good fights, make plays that can gain an advantage, help teammates, or try to encourage my team to go for objectives rather than meaningless kills. I'm tired of going all in and blowing EVERYTHING while my team sits in the back jerking off or just leaving. Last game i had a jungle poppy, and there was a soraka w/o and summoners, so i went in to try to get the kill for poppy. She just walked past us like there was nothing happening. 
Maybe it's just my elo, or something. In the preseason I started playing jg/mid and was able to get to gold before my mmr reset. It's just i have so much fun playing the support champions, just not so much fun trying to win with them.

Because the utility doesn't need to be buffed, the problem is when idiot teammates don't play to the strengths of the support. Supports 'can' carry, it just depends on whether or not the team understands how to play, I mean really, can you imagine how obnoxious it would be to be polymorphed for five seconds or some shit? No support is fine as far as their strength goes, it's just not a good position if your teammates are morons.

Let me offer a bit of perspective from a player that's been playing League since early beta. Now keep in mind, I'm by no means some diamond+ player. I've only peaked at Plat 2 at best, but hopefully this helps people that main support. I've played each role plenty over the years, but during my first year or two of LoL, I focused on primarily supporting. Back in my DotA days, I mained support too. So...many...omniknight...games...and CM...and so on. First and foremost, you're going to have to accept that people will often ignore you as a support. Seeing as you aren't doing any Insec plays with Lee Sin or shadow swapping with Zed, not many will realize how much you are doing to keep your team working smoothly. Vision is a team game, but it's mostly in your hands. Often enough, your abilities make or break fights with even just one clutch heal/shield. Your K/D/A wont have much more than some deaths and assists. People will even forget WHY you died to get all those kills for your teammates. Sure, by now you already know all this, but the sad thing is, many forget what a support TRULY does. I think of it like a military medic. You save lives, you aren't necessarily meant for combat, but you sure as hell will do what you can to save people. Kind of silly to use something so heroic as a comparison to video games, but you get my drift. ;P

With all that in mind, take a step back. Consider how many people play games like LoL for glory, a sense of accomplishment, or even just bragging rights. There's such a large combination of egos mixing into one game under specific conditions required for success. Lots of people don't realize how much their team could give to make that Pentakill happen though. One Amumu ult that catches all 5 people, or a mantra'd Karma E that just barely mitigates damage that would have wiped your whole team. There's so many different possibilities. That's what makes this game so great to play for me. You'll meet some real crappy people on the internet for sure, but man...finding that group of people(or even just one or two)is a pretty awesome feeling. Don't let the bad people ruin the game for you, because you'll definitely get good games filled with good people. I guarantee that. One of those good people I met playing this game ended up being my best man in my wedding. What are the chances of that? ;D

Don't give up though. I challenge ADC mains to play support for a while to understand the struggle of the role. Laners, try jungling to get the feeling of how much presence everyone expects of you. Mid mains, try playing a tank top/jungle to know how much your frontline dies for you to get the job done. 

Find what makes you enjoy what you play and play it. If you can't, take a break or find something else. My hope is that everyone that has this struggle gets past a slump like this. At the end of the day we should be enjoying this game together. We're a community and a family when it comes down to it. Let's stop tearing each other down and just play the game we all enjoy.

Best of luck to each of you guys that feel like OP here, and keep playing your favorite roles!

It's worth mentioning that Riot has some changes in store for supports after the patch this week. From what they said, they are making it easier for supports to get high grades and keep up in level. I'd wait another week or 2 to see what Riot has in store for supports before hanging up the towel all together. 
They seem aware of lots of the issues facing support champs and are pushing out a mini class update to try and alleviate the problems till they are in a better spot to do a full class update for support champs.
I've always found support the easiest to get high grades. I have all my tokens for rank 7 Leona. Just working on that blue essence.

Apparently your in the minority, seeing as Riot thinks that supports are the ones who need help with mastery. It's a good minority to be in mind you, as when they do make these changes, it's just going to be all the easier for you. I'm just hoping the changes they make will make the Support role more desired, balancing out the role selection so you can pick Top or Mid and not wait 10 - 15 minutes.

right now the supports who feel hardest to achieve S mastery with are the "traditional" supports like Janna. "damage" supports or tanks are generally having an easier time - damaging supports generally pick up kills, and tanks don't get a lot of deaths. A utility support like Janna (or someone like Nami? Lulu kinda does both but mostly is picked for her utility?) is going to be building some defensive/aura items but primarily is focusing on utility for the team, so comes out squishier than a tank, but also isn't getting kills. I've had many Janna games where I'm like 1/2/30 and I get a B+ or A-, while a 4/1/9 or 5/1/10 on my team gets A+ or S-.

It was in the [State of the Season](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/gameplay/state-season-mid-season-followup) post. Near the end Meddler added what they have planned for the next few patches (up to 6.18) and it's at the part about patch 6.13. The rest of it pretty much just sounds like "we like everything the way it is and do not plan to change it.", but that part was nice to see.

I'm actually hoping the changes make it so every champ can receive a better grade for the same stuff supports will be getting points for. 
I do know he said that they will make it easier for everyone to see why they got the grade they did so they can work on improving in areas they are lacking in, so there is at least that.
I would love a little post-game popup for "You didn't make S grade because XYZ".

It will definitely help a lot of people who wish to reach level 7 with a champ, but don't know what is keeping them from reaching S rank. 
In the Poro king mode, It took me getting a score of 14/9/23, killing 2 turrets and summoning the poro king 2 times just to get an S- and the Velkoz on our team did better than me, yet he only got an A+.

Context on our grades should really help take the randomness out of the grading system.

I think I can help you there. I have a theory that S ranks in RGM appear to be based off both performance and a checklist.

For example, the last round of Poro King, I played a lot of Morgana because I didn't have her S rank chest. Three games I did very well, and got an A+. I was livid until I realized that I had only been using one summoner spell, the poro toss. I never had a situation in those three games where I needed to teleport to the King.

So I get into a game, do about as well as I did the other three games, but used both summoners frequently. I teleported to the King even when I was right behind him, needlessly, several times. Did everything else as much the same as I could. Boom, S rank.

I also noticed that players who ascend in Ascension at least twice for any amount of time (and do even decently well as far as K/D) tend to gather S ranks like they were candy. Don't get me wrong, it's easy to rack up the kills and points when you're ascended, but there are times those golden giants don't live long enough to do anything.

As far as the RGM go, I believe a large part of S ranks is using the unique features of the gamemode even if you don't actually accomplish much with them. The game only seems to care if you did them in the first place.

I tried to test this on Hexakill, but there's nothing really unique to that mode other than the capture points and Vilemaw. I've had two S rank games as Chogath and my team never got Vilemaw either time. Point capture _seems_ to be a check on the checklist, but it's hard to gather data when you don't get credit for helping to capture a point your ally got to first and you can't retake a point until the enemy take it back.

That does make a lot of sense. I wound up teleporting to him a lot, ether to get to the rest of my team from base or to retreat from the enemy team ganging up on me, but I couldn't think of many points when {{champion:161}} used it.
Though I do feel like that's a pretty forced way to grade people, just so they can have mastery in RGM. I feel like it's just screaming "Hey look, this is unique to this mode! Use this feature more!"

I've noticed huge improvements from my team and myself once I get good vision down.  Good luck on the climb!

Dude, it's support. You aren't supposed to carry, your role is to babysit the bot laner so he can carry and do good. If you don't like how that role is (no carry potential) then try a different role! bot lane isn't for everybody, mid lane is a carry role.

Whether a support or not can "carry" is not what a lot of us hate as supports. We hate when 

1) When someone does not know how to react/play with a support at all. I understand League can have things happen fast, and people are not on the same wave length, but a lot of players don't know how to take advantage of the things their support does for them. It is one thing to let a kill slip by because of the speed at which things happen, but to not gain an advantage at all is frustrating as a support player. Especially when they don't act at all.
2) When a teammate that we save from dying using skills/exhaust ignores ping cautions and walks back too close to action where they end up dying after we got them to safety.


3) WHEN I JUMP IN TO PROTECT THE ADC AND THEY START FOCUSING ME, ATTACK THEM BACK!!! This drives me crazy when you get the adc that just bails when you could still win a fight if they would actually fight.

These things make playing the role feel frustrating at times.
